prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing social media post engagement:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "PostID": ["SM01", "SM02", "SM03", "SM04", "SM05"],
    "Platform": ["Instagram", "Twitter", "Facebook", "Instagram", "Twitter"],
    "PostType": ["Image", "Text", "Video", "Image", "Text"],
    "Likes": [150, 80, 300, 200, 90],
    "Shares": [20, 15, 50, 30, 10],
    "Comments": [10, 5, 25, 15, 8]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Print the total number of "Likes" across all posts. 2) Find and print the "PostType" that has the highest average number of "Shares". Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, calculate total likes, and identify the post type with the highest average shares.
